game_engine module¶

Simple game engine for battleships. only the simple 1 player game is supported.

game_engine.attack(coordinates: tuple[int, int], board: list[list[str]], ships: dict[str, int]) → bool¶

Carries out an attack on a specific square.

Parameters:

  • coordinates (tuple) – The square being attacked.

  • board (list) – The board of the player being attacked.

  • ships (dict) – The ships of the player being attacked.

Return bool:

game_engine.cli_coordinates_input() → tuple[int, int]¶

Gets a pair of coordinates representing a square from the user.

Returns:

The square entered by the user.

Return type:

tuple

game_engine.simple_game_loop() → None¶

Simple single player game loop.

game_engine.validate_coords_input(coords: str) → bool¶

Validates input with regex.

Parameters:

coords (str) – the coordinates entered by the user:

Returns:

whether the input is valid or not:

Return type:

bool

game_engine.wintest(ships: dict[str, int]) → bool¶

Checks if all of a player’s ships have been sunk.

Parameters:

ships (dict) – The player’s ships.

Returns:

Whether the player has no ships remaining or not.

Return type:

bool

ECM1400 battleships
